books.title: Futility
books.author: William Gerhardie
books.summary: An English man befriends three young women from a soon-to-be-wealthy Russian family.

books.title: The Man Who Knew
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A English millionaire with a seedy past in Africa discovers that his worst fears have come true.

books.title: The Autobiography of John Stuart Mill
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: The autobiography of English philosopher John Stuart Mill.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Wet Magic
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A group of children visiting the seaside free a captive mermaid and visit her domain.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: R. A. Lafferty
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by R. A. Lafferty ordered by date of publication.

books.title: A Tangled Tale
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: Ten mathematical puzzles presented as comedic short stories.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Insidious Dr. Fu-Manchu
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: An intrepid detective hunts the criminal mastermind Fu-Manchu through early 20th-century London.

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Okakura Kakuzō
books.summary: The Book of Tea is a long essay exploring the relationship between teaism, taoism, and the aesthetics of Japanese culture.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: The Columbiad
books.author: Joel Barlow
books.summary: Columbus is shown a history of the western hemisphere since his discoveries.

books.title: Gulliver’s Travels
books.author: Jonathan Swift
books.summary: An Englishman travels to fictional islands where he meets tiny people, giants, magicians and talking horses.

books.title: The War of the Worlds
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: The first-person narrative of the Martian invasion of 19th-century Earth.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.
